32#include <sys/cdefs.h>
33__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: drm_fops.c,v 1.14 2018/08/27 15:22:54 riastradh Exp $");
34
35#include <sys/param.h>
36#include <sys/select.h>
37
38#include <drm/drmP.h>
39#include <drm/drm_internal.h>
40#include <drm/drm_legacy.h>
41#include "../dist/drm/drm_legacy.h"
42
43static int drm_open_file_master(struct drm_file *);
44
45static void drm_master_release(struct drm_file *);
46static void drm_events_release(struct drm_file *);
47static void drm_close_file_master(struct drm_file *);
48
49int
50drm_open_file(struct drm_file *file, void *fp, struct drm_minor *minor)
51{
52 struct drm_device *const dev = minor->dev;
53 int ret;
54
55 file->authenticated = DRM_SUSER(); /* XXX */
56 file->is_master = false;
57 file->stereo_allowed = false;
58 file->universal_planes = false;
59 file->atomic = false;
60 file->allowed_master = false;
61 file->magic = 0;
62 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&file->lhead);
63 file->minor = minor;
64 file->lock_count = 0;
65 /* file->object_idr is initialized by drm_gem_open. */
66 /* file->table_lock is initialized by drm_gem_open. */
67 file->filp = fp;
68 file->driver_priv = NULL;
69 file->master = NULL;
70 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&file->fbs);
71 linux_mutex_init(&file->fbs_lock);
72 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&file->blobs);
73 DRM_INIT_WAITQUEUE(&file->event_wait, "drmevent");
74 selinit(&file->event_selq);
75 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&file->event_list);
76 file->event_space = 0x1000; /* XXX cargo-culted from Linux */
77 /* file->prime is initialized by drm_prime_init_file_private. */
78
79 if (drm_core_check_feature(dev, DRIVER_GEM))
80 drm_gem_open(dev, file);
81 if (drm_core_check_feature(dev, DRIVER_PRIME))
82 drm_prime_init_file_private(&file->prime);
83
84 if (dev->driver->open) {
85 ret = (*dev->driver->open)(dev, file);
86 if (ret)
87 goto fail0;
88 }
89
90 ret = drm_open_file_master(file);
91 if (ret)
92 goto fail1;
93
94 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
95 list_add(&file->lhead, &dev->filelist);
96 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
97
98 /* Success! */
99 return 0;
100
101fail1: /*
102 * XXX This error branch needs scrutiny, but Linux's error
103 * branches are incomprehensible and look wronger.
104 */
105 if (dev->driver->preclose)
106 (*dev->driver->preclose)(dev, file);
107 if (dev->driver->postclose)
108 (*dev->driver->postclose)(dev, file);
109fail0:
110 if (drm_core_check_feature(dev, DRIVER_PRIME))
111 drm_prime_destroy_file_private(&file->prime);
112 if (drm_core_check_feature(dev, DRIVER_GEM))
113 drm_gem_release(dev, file);
114 return ret;
115}
116
117int
118drm_new_set_master(struct drm_device *dev, struct drm_file *file)
119{
120 struct drm_master *old_master;
121 int ret;
122
123 KASSERT(mutex_is_locked(&dev->master_mutex));
124 KASSERT(file->minor->type == DRM_MINOR_LEGACY);
125 KASSERT(file->minor->master == NULL);
126
127 file->minor->master = drm_master_create(file->minor);
128 if (file->minor->master == NULL) {
129 ret = -ENOMEM;
130 goto fail0;
131 }
132
133 /*
134 * Save the old master, to drop a reference later if all goes
135 * well, and get a reference to the new one.
136 */
137 old_master = file->master;
138 file->master = drm_master_get(file->minor->master);
139
140 /* Invoke the driver callbacks master_create and master_set. */
141 if (dev->driver->master_create) {
142 ret = (*dev->driver->master_create)(dev, file->minor->master);
143 if (ret)
144 goto fail1;
145 }
146
147 if (dev->driver->master_set) {
148 ret = (*dev->driver->master_set)(dev, file, true);
149 if (ret)
150 goto fail1;
151 }
152
153 /*
154 * Mark ourselves as an authenticated master, and allowed to
155 * set a new master.
156 */
157 file->is_master = 1;
158 file->allowed_master = 1;
159 file->authenticated = 1;
160
161 /* If there was an old master, release it now. */
162 if (old_master)
163 drm_master_put(&old_master);
164
165 /* Success! */
166 return 0;
167
168fail1:
169 /* Release the master we just created. */
170 drm_master_put(&file->minor->master);
171 KASSERT(file->minor->master == NULL);
172 /* Release the reference we just added in the file. */
173 drm_master_put(&file->master);
174 KASSERT(file->master == NULL);
175 /* Restore the old master if there was one. */
176 file->master = old_master;
177fail0: KASSERT(ret);
178 return ret;
179}
180
181static int
182drm_open_file_master(struct drm_file *file)
183{
184 struct drm_device *const dev = file->minor->dev;
185 int ret;
186
187 /* If this is not the legacy device, there are no masters. */
188 if (file->minor->type != DRM_MINOR_LEGACY)
189 return 0;
190
191 mutex_lock(&dev->master_mutex);
192 if (file->minor->master != NULL) {
193 /*
194 * If the minor already has a master, get a reference
195 * to it.
196 */
197 file->master = drm_master_get(file->minor->master);
198 ret = 0;
199 } else {
200 /*
201 * Otherwise, automatically behave as though we had
202 * just done setmaster.
203 */
204 ret = drm_new_set_master(dev, file);
205 }
206 mutex_unlock(&dev->master_mutex);
207
208 return ret;
209}
210
211void
212drm_close_file(struct drm_file *file)
213{
214 struct drm_minor *const minor = file->minor;
215 struct drm_device *const dev = minor->dev;
216
217 mutex_lock(&dev->struct_mutex);
218 list_del(&file->lhead);
219 if (file->magic)
220 idr_remove(&file->master->magic_map, file->magic);
221 mutex_unlock(&dev->struct_mutex);
222
223 if (dev->driver->preclose)
224 (*dev->driver->preclose)(dev, file);
225
226 if (minor->master)
227 drm_master_release(file);
228 if (drm_core_check_feature(dev, DRIVER_HAVE_DMA))
229 drm_legacy_reclaim_buffers(dev, file);
230 drm_events_release(file);
231 if (drm_core_check_feature(dev, DRIVER_MODESET)) {
232 drm_fb_release(file);
233 drm_property_destroy_user_blobs(dev, file);
234 }
235 if (drm_core_check_feature(dev, DRIVER_GEM))
236 drm_gem_release(dev, file);
237 drm_legacy_ctxbitmap_flush(dev, file);
238 drm_close_file_master(file);
239
240 if (dev->driver->postclose)
241 (*dev->driver->postclose)(dev, file);
242
243 if (drm_core_check_feature(dev, DRIVER_PRIME))
244 drm_prime_destroy_file_private(&file->prime);
245
246 seldestroy(&file->event_selq);
247 DRM_DESTROY_WAITQUEUE(&file->event_wait);
248 linux_mutex_destroy(&file->fbs_lock);
249}
250
251static void
252drm_master_release(struct drm_file *file)
253{
254
255 /*
256 * XXX I think this locking concept is wrong -- we need to hold
257 * file->master->lock.spinlock across the two calls to
258 * drm_legacy_i_have_hw_lock and drm_legacy_lock_free.
259 */
260 if (drm_legacy_i_have_hw_lock(file->minor->dev, file))
261 drm_legacy_lock_free(&file->master->lock,
262 _DRM_LOCKING_CONTEXT(file->master->lock.hw_lock->lock));
263}
264
265static void
266drm_events_release(struct drm_file *file)
267{
268 struct drm_device *const dev = file->minor->dev;
269 struct drm_pending_vblank_event *vblank, *vblank_next;
270 struct drm_pending_event *event, *event_next;
271 unsigned long flags;
272
273 spin_lock_irqsave(&dev->event_lock, flags);
274
275 list_for_each_entry_safe(vblank, vblank_next, &dev->vblank_event_list,
276 base.link) {
277 if (vblank->base.file_priv == file) {
278 list_del(&vblank->base.link);
279 drm_vblank_put(dev, vblank->pipe);
280 (*vblank->base.destroy)(&vblank->base);
281 }
282 }
283 list_for_each_entry_safe(event, event_next, &file->event_list, link) {
284 (*event->destroy)(event);
285 }
286
287 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&dev->event_lock, flags);
288}
289
290static void
291drm_close_file_master(struct drm_file *file)
292{
293 struct drm_device *const dev = file->minor->dev;
294
295 mutex_lock(&dev->master_mutex);
296 if (file->is_master) {
297 if (file->minor->master == file->master) {
298 if (dev->driver->master_drop)
299 (*dev->driver->master_drop)(dev, file, true);
300 drm_master_put(&file->minor->master);
301 }
302 }
303 if (file->master != NULL)
304 drm_master_put(&file->master);
305 file->is_master = 0;
306 mutex_unlock(&dev->master_mutex);
307}
